channel.title: How to build a 64 bit run

item.title: How to build a 64 bit run
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“wrath0fgufix, post:7, topic:337066”]Java, you are wrong, 32 bit computers are used with certain cleint 64 are different.[/quote] only when the system files have a specified working like 32bit.
instead of using @echo off cls "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit
use the one you already have and it works just the same. i know because i run on a 64bit!

Read full topic
item.source: How to build a 64 bit run

item.title: How to build a 64 bit run
item.dc:creator: @iamapker iamapker
item.description:
@iamapker wrote:

if you are having issues with 64-bit (which is what i am using) then where you added the system variables if you did, you add them to User and System so both sections also yeah change your compiler to what was told above, more questions pm me

item.title: How to build a 64 bit run
item.dc:creator: @chocothunda chocothunda
item.description:
@chocothunda wrote:

To make a client work with 64-bit, make this your run. @echo off cls "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit

Read full topic
item.source: How to build a 64 bit run

item.title: How to build a 64 bit run
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

that should work just fine you don’t have to make anything 64bit it should run on their computers the same. if it doesn’t they need to figure out why.

Read full topic

item.title: How to build a 64 bit run
item.dc:creator: @wrath0fgufix wrath0fgufix
item.description:
@wrath0fgufix wrote:

What? i’m asking cause other people have 64bit computers… my regular run:

@echo off title Client cd Files iexplore http://www.voteplease.tk/ Start javaw -Xmx1000m -cp .;Theme.jar client exit

Read full topic
